newsitem.title: USA: BPA raises Thurs. peak, firm power by $2.00/MWh.
newsitem.headline: BPA raises Thurs. peak, firm power by $2.00/MWh.

text.p: The Bonneville Power Administration (BPA) offered 200 megawatts (MW) of firm power during peak demand hours on Thursday at prices $2.00 per megawatt (MWh) higher than the previous day, the agency said Wednesday.
BPA offered next-day firm peak power at $15.00 per MWh for Northwest deliveries and at $16.00 for California-Oregon border (COB) sales.
Offers of unlimited firm power during light load hours on Thursday remained unchanged at $9.00 a MWh.
BPA left Thursday prices for non-firm power for hours ending 0100-0500 PDT 2400 PDT unchanged at $7.00 per MWh for Northwest sales and $8.00 for COB.
Prices for non-firm power during hours ending 0600-0700 PDT and 2300 PDT were also unchanged at $10.00 for all deliveries.
